Note.Content: In {S:04000602800024} the Sinaiticus manuscript has an interesting reading, οὐ ξένουσιν (= οὐ ξαίνουσιν), thus providing three processes or activities involving cloth rather than two. However, in view of the relatively limited support for this reading, most translators follow the text which has αὐξάνουσιν they grow.

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: to comb wool as an initial step in the making of wool thread{N:001}
LEXSense.Comments: οὐ ξαίνουσιν οὐδὲ νήθουσιν οὐδὲ κοπιῶσιν ‘they do not comb wool, spin, or work hard’ {S:04000602800024} (apparatus)
